Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings.___

Mike Pence said he made the final decision not to run for president Wednesday night. He and his wife told their two daughters and then called their son, who is in college, early Thursday. We just concluded that while we could seek the presidency, we concluded that our best opportunity to continue to serve the people of Indiana was either in Washington, D.C., or here at home, Mike Pence said. continue to raise money as a member of Congress). But Indiana senator Dan Coats tells NRO that if and when Mike Pence does announce, he will enter the governor's race as the frontrunner. He is clearly someone who could carry on the remarkable success of Mitch Daniels , Dan Coats says. "I am going to strongly encourage him to run. I know he's going to take a little Tim Pawlentye to assess it, but I hope he's our next governor."
